_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: Relief Valves; Snap Switches, Valves; Tanks; Unit Controls; Station Controls; Pipelines

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

The safety of our employees, contract employees, customers, neighbors and the environment is a core business value and an important priority. Reducing the impact of our operations on the environment is also a priority. NuStar Energy LP is committed to achieving Health, Safety and Environmental (HSE) excellence throughout the organization.

NuStar management has also agreed to correct in a timely manner all hazards identified through self inspections, employee reports, accident investigations, or any other means with interim protection as necessary.

We will provide the results of self-inspections and accident investigation to our employees upon request.

We will continuously seek areas for improvement and ways to raise our employees level of awareness regarding all aspects of safety and health.

The Geneva Terminal was built and put into service in 1953. The facility was built to store and transport propane (RMP regulated substance), refined products and a Liquid Mixture (LM) of the two products. The propane, refined products and the LM are delivered, via a 10" pipeline, to the Geneva Terminal from the NuStar Terminal in McPherson,Kansas. The 6,321,840 lbs. of propane, which exceeds the 10,000 lbs. threshold quantity (TQ) of the OSHA PSM requirements, is stored in, one of sixteen, pressurized bullet tanks. The LM is stored in two pressurized bullet tanks. The propane is removed from the site by either propane trucks that deliver it to various customers, or by one of four pipelines, which consist of two 8" pipelines and two 6" pipelines.

The Geneva Facility complies with many different regulatory agencies, which include, but not limited to;

 - OSHAs Process Safety Management (PSM) Program (1910.119) of Highly Hazardous Chemicals.

 - OSHAs Emergency Action Plan Regulation, 29 CFR 1910.38(c).

 - OSHAs HAZWOPER Regulation, 29 CFR 1910.120.

 - Federal Oil Pollution Act of 1990: U.S. DOT Final Rule for Transportation Related On-Shore Facilities as

published in 49 CFR Part 194 (Response Plans for Onshore Oil Pipelines).

 - Federal Oil Pollution Act of 1990: U.S. EPA Final Rule for non-Transportation Related on-Shore Facilities as published in 40 CFR Part 112.

 - DOT Part 195 A: Transportation of Hazardous Liquids by Pipeline.

 - DOT Part 199 A: Drug and Alcohol Testing.

The Geneva Facility conducts two equipment deployment drills (one un-announced) a year, Quarterly Qualified Individual (QI) drills and an annual table top drill is performed during the annual HAZWOPER training. 

The Geneva Facility has a excellent five year release free history. We have had no accidental releases in the last five years. 

The Geneva Emergency Response Program works together with the Geneva Fire Department. The Geneva employees are not first responders, but have received training in the notification process of the Geneva Fire Department (first responder). The employees also participate in an annual evacuation drill, in the event an evacuation is required. 

Various employees at the Geneva Terminal have received CPR training, and all employees have received annual HAZWOPER training. Numerous other drills are conducted at the Geneva Terminal as stated previously.

Safety is the #1 core value of our company. Whether in performing everyday work or in the planning and maintenance of project work, safety is top priority. Some of the future improvements towards safety are: 

 - Management and employees have teamed together to earn the OSHA VPP Star award and the recertification 3 years later. In this pursuit, there were several changes planned to improve safety and some of them were;

  * Quarterly Hazard Identification Audits

  * Electrical cord quarterly inspection program

  * First Use Vehicle inspection program

  * Lifting sling(s) quarterly inspection program

  * The regional office has implemented an electronic MOC process, which has helped expedite the approval process and provide a more in-depth safety analysis of the

proposed change. 

  * An electronic MSDS (SDS) approval process has been completed which allows all users at any of the sites the ability to view any SDS through the company intranet. 

  * The entire region uses the company CEM (Certified Environmental Management) to perform the Industrial Hygiene testing.

  * NuStar has implemented automatic tank gauging which alleviates the need to climb the tanks on a daily basis.
